title: Song Conserning the Whale Which Could Not Be Eaten
lyrics_translation: The oil of this whale is red because the little bird has made it so.

title: Song Concerning the Eatable Whale
lyrics_translation: We got this whale because the little bird was not at home

title: Song of the Married Man Who Became a Whaler
lyrics_translation: Go into that bay, that is the path (meaning the landing place of the canoe)

title: Song to Make a Wounded Whale Swim Toward Shore
lyrics_translation:
Use your other flipper.
Paddle toward our home.

title: Song of Gathering at Which Fin Was Displayed
lyrics_translation:
I come in,
I am rolling (not walking) but I am a man

title: "I Come to the Land"
lyrics_translation:
Here I come from way out, to the land,
To visit as many places as I can.

title: A Whale Returns
lyrics_translation: I am coming back to be caught again

title: Song of a Whale
lyrics_translation:
I have come to see how your house is,
Is it prepared for large crowds?

title: Song of the Oil Potlatch
lyrics_translation: Here I have come to the place where people live

title: Dance Song of the Young Women
Song of Invitation to a Potlatch
Song of the Guests in Their Canoes
comments: Drum rhythm: continuous eigth-notes|The drum and voice use different tempi

title: Song of a Guest at a Potlatch
comments: Drum rhythm: continous quarters|The drum and voice use different tempi: voice=72, drum=84

title: Song of the Kwikwatla Dance
comments: Drum rhythm: continous quarters|"It was accompanied by pounding with sticks on a large box, this being done by the assembly"

title: Song of the Host at a Potlatch
Song Before Distribution of Gifts (a)
comments: On the previous page, Densmore writes that "the next two songs [...] are accompanied by a rapid beating of sticks on plancks, and the dancers clapped their hands sharply at the accented tones of the song"
lyrics_translation: I am wealthy, that is why I am singing

title: Song Before Distribution of Gifts (b)
comments: Drum rhythm: continous eight-notes|On the previous page, Densmore writes that "the next two songs [...] are accompanied by a rapid beating of sticks on plancks, and the dancers clapped their hands sharply at the accented tones of the song"
lyrics_translation: It is I who am dancing

title: "Mine is a Proud Village"
lyrics_translation:
Mine is a proud village, such as it is,
We are at our best when dancing.

title: Song of the Women Guests
lyrics_translation: We have come to see what you have to give away at your potlatch

title: "The Rattle is my Tumanos"
lyrics_translation: I am rich because the rattle is my tumanos

title: Potlatch Song
lyrics_translation: It is too bad about the presents that I and the other men were so pleased about

title: Song of Santiano at a Potlatch
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs with contest of medicine after potlatch"}
comments: Meaning of the words is not known

title: Song Concerning a Man's Tumanos
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs with contests of medicine after potlatch"}
lyrics_translation: The man's tumanos is the same as a certain great man's tumanos (naming the man)

title: Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (a)
comments: "It is a song of the Wyatch and is so old that the meaning of the words is not known"

title: Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (b)
Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (c)
Song of Women's Dance (b)
comments: "It is said to be very old, and the words are forgotten"

title: "The Other Tribes Are Praising Me"
lyrics_translation:
I am telling what the other tribes are talking about.
I hear everything they say and they are all praising me.

title: Song of the Kluklukwatk Dance (a)
comments: Meaning of the words was unknown

title: Song of the Kluklukwatk Dance (b)
lyrics_translation: Dance slowly

title: "I Am Dancing in the Air"
lyrics_translation: I am dancing in the air and dancing round and round

title: Klokali Song (a)
lyrics_translation: My dancer is the day

title: Klokali Song Learned From a Slave (a)
lyrics_translation:
The nuchin who lives in the woods is a man;
The klechin who lives in the woods is a man.

title: Klokali Song Learned From a Slave (b)
"We Make You Join the Klokali"
lyrics_translation: Here we come from above to make you join the Klokali

title: "Ten Large Diamonds"
lyrics_translation:
At a place far away there are ten large diamonds.
This is the news which the thunderbird brings to you.

title: "I Possess the Salt Water"
lyrics_translation:
Listen to me, I have possession of the salt water.
I feed your herring and fish whenever you are not able to catch them for your use.

title: Lightning Dance Song
lyrics_translation: What could be greater than that which I imitate.

title: "The Wolves Are Howling"
lyrics_translation:
The wolves are howling,
Let this be a pleasant day.

title: Wand Dance Song - with 2nd rendition drums
comments: Different drum rhythms in different renditions; see publication

title: Song With Impersonation of the Wild White Geese
Song With Impersonation of the Deer (a)
lyrics_translation: My hands are my feathers

title: Song With Impersonation of the Deer (b)
lyrics_translation:
Representing a deer,
Representing a blackfish

title: Song With Impersonation of a Little Fish
Song With Impersonation of a Raven
Song of the Horsemen
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (a)
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}
comments: "The words are not in the Makah language and the meaning is not known"|Drum tempo is given in half notes|Drum rhythm: continuous half notes

title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (b)
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (c)
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}
lyrics_translation:
On all fours on the water is my craft,
Flashing light is my craft.

title: Song With Spearman's Dance
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Klikitat Dance Song
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Song With Changeable Mask Dance
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Makah Homatsa Song
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Homatsa Song (a)
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Homatsa Song (b)
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Nootka Homatsa Song
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Entering Dance Song
other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

title: Song of Defiance (a)
lyrics_translation: You will not find my path, even if you do go.

title: Song of Pintlachatl Dance (a)
comments: Drum rhythm similar to no. 10|Drum and voice have different tempi

title: Song of Pintlachatl Dance (d)
lyrics_translation:
I have seen my tumanos,
Is your tumanos as good as mine?

title: "Do Not Try to Imitate Me"
lyrics_translation:
Do not try to imitate me in my ways,
If I invented other tribes I would have wolves on the beach,
Do not try to imitate me

title: Song Belonging to the Last Makah Chief
lyrics_translation: There is no tribe that can beat the chief in dancing.

title: Song After Food Was Served
comments: "The song is so old that the meaning of the words is lost except that one sentence means 'A chief is in a canoe with many men'"
lyrics_translation: [...] A chief is in a canoe with many men" [...]

title: "I Am Trying to Look as Pretty as I Can"
lyrics_translation:
I am trying to look as pretty as I can because my sweetheart is in the crowd.
He is the reason for it.

title: Social Song
comments: Drum rhythm similar to no. 13|Drum and voice use different tempi (voice=86, drum=72)

title: "Do Not Go Away"
lyrics_translation:
Do not go away when I call you. 
?oanak (meaning very poor, thin, unhealthy woman) came before she was called

title: "They Come From Under the Water"
lyrics_translation: They come to the surface, whatever lives under the water

title: Courtesy Song (a)
lyrics_translation: I do believe that person on the horse has taken the ring.

title: Courtesy Song (b)
lyrics_translation:
It seems that my husband is scolding me all the time.
(Some one is supposed to reply)
Perhaps he has a reason for scolding you.

title: "I Will Not Have Him"
comments: Drum rhythm in publication|Drum and voice have different tempi (voice=65; drum=56)
lyrics_translation:
I will not, I will not have him because he is too old.
His head and shoulders are good looking but
I will not have him anyway because he is too old.

title: "I Look Like a Sea Parrot"
lyrics_translation: Of all the things that come with old age, I look like a sea parrot with white patches on the side of my head. Try to become old as quickly as you can, I look so handsome.

title: "How High My Forehead Is Getting"
lyrics_translation:
How high my forehead is getting.
This is the first time I have looked in the glass.

title: "I Am Getting Old"
lyrics_translation: What a pity I am getting old

title: "My Dear Friend is Going Away"
lyrics_translation:
My dear friend Wislatas is going away,
My very close friend Wislatas is going away.

title: Song at Parting
comments: Sung partly in English, partly in Chinook|Drum rhythm similar to no. 10
lyrics_translation: Good-by, my sweetheart

title: Song of the Crew
lyrics_translation: I can see the snow on top of the mountains

title: "I Hear the Bird Singing"
lyrics_translation: I hear the bird singing in the high mountains

title: "Stop Singing"
lyrics_translation: Stop singing, they are beginning to make fun of you.

title: Song of the War Club
lyrics_translation:
Who is my equal or can compare with me?
I have forty whales on my beach.

title: "I Will Not Cut Off Your Head"
lyrics_translation: The only reason why I do not cut off your head is that your face would have a crying expression when I carried the head.

title: Song on the Way to War
"You Cannot Defeat Us"
lyrics_translation: Do not think for a moment that you can defeat us, for we own slaves from all other tribes, even from the coast tribes to the north.

title: Makah War Song
lyrics_translation: The Makah have no equals in numbers or strength. It is nothing for us to have 40 whales on the beach in a day.

title: Song of Those Who Remained at Home
lyrics_translation:
I have become weak by speaking of my home.
My home is a great home.

title: Song of a Head Hunter
lyrics_translation: There is my head (that I took).

title: Song of a Returning War Party
Clayoquot War Song (b)
lyrics_translation: Jump in, Akse'tsus, and take ten.

title: Head Hunter's Song of Triumph
comments: "The words mean 'The head I cut off is bleeding'"
lyrics_translation: Mine is bleeding.

title: Song Addressed to a Shark
lyrics_translation: Where are you, on whose back the waves break?

title: Song to Bring Rain
lyrics_translation: Rain, please come down and fill the depressions in the rock

title: Song of the Man on the Rock
lyrics_translation: You will always find me by the beating of my drum

title: "In the Treetop"
lyrics_translation: O brothers, here he has put me in the treetop

title: Song of the Squirrel
lyrics_translation: My tumanos is the squirrel

title: Song of the Little Slave Man
lyrics_translation: Whoever is knocking at the door is only pretending that he is my master.

title: "She Will Pick Salmonberries"
lyrics_translation: This little girl will pick black salmonberries when the women go to get berries because she is a sister of Kaka'ochuk and a daughter of Kaka'ochuk (a little bird with brown feathers and high repeated note).

title: "The Other Babies Bother Me"
lyrics_translation: The only reason I cannot gather more berries is that so many other babies are bothering me

title: "I Wish I Was Out on the Rocks"
lyrics_translation:
I wish I was out on the rocks gathering sidu. the tide is just right.
I wish I was gathering crabsm the early morning tide is out.

title: "Let Us Go After Crabs"
lyrics_translation: I think we had better go after crabs, they do not hurt so badly when they pinch the hands.

title: "Go to Sleep"
lyrics_translation: Go to sleep, baby daughter, mother has work that must be done.

title: Song to a Little Girl
lyrics_translation: My little girl is such a great care

title: A Song of Prophecy
lyrics_translation: Everybody will be afraid to look upon his little face because on his little round cheeck will be a xixitiyuk (belt of the thunderbird)

title: "I Will Be a Great Warrior"
lyrics_translation: I am going to be a great warrior, because the crows have given me medicine to make me so.

title: "My Little Son"
lyrics_translation:
My baby boy, my little baby boy, my little son.
You will put a sealing spear into your canoe, without knowing what use you may make of it when you are a man.

title: A Basket Full of Snipe
lyrics_translation:
What a nice basket full of snipe you are carrying.
You got them at Tcatca'tiks.

title: "I Am Going To Be a Fisherman"
lyrics_translation: Because my parents want to trade me for a good-for-nothing little old pot, I am going to be a good fisherman.

title: "My Canoe Is Full of Kelp Fish"
lyrics_translation:
Take your basket out and fill it with kelp fish.
My canoe is full of kelp fish but I threw out the bullheads.

title: Fathoms of Wumpum Shell
lyrics_translation:
I have for sale, for sale, 10 fathoms of wampum shell for a fishing spear.
It belongs to Klikababit.

title: Song Concerning Kwati's Anklets
lyrics_translation: Kwati's ankles are small from wearing such heavy anklets for so long.

title: Bear Song
comments: Drum rhythm similar to no. 10|Drum and voice use different tempi (voice=84, drum=132)
lyrics_translation: I am hungry for salmonberries
